content.description: Sit start with hands on the two lowest edges and work your way out to the left crimp, and up through the remaining sharp crimps and pockets. Definitely eases up as you move up the wall.
content.location: This is the middle route in the Padded Room Area. Obvious line and top out area.

content.description: Slightly sandy on the middle jugs and the topout. Good quality rock for all the hard moves.
content.location: Start on Pressed for Jess and traverse across the center of the wall into the top crimps of Petri Dish. Fun shoulder intensive moves on good edges.

content.description: This problem has a very dangerous landing from the top out, and a large boulder directly behind you  that can pose a problem if you are only carrying a few pads with you. Sit-start Petri-dish hands on lowest slopers, traverse the huecos to the arete, compress your way to the face, the problem heads out left when  you reach the face. Climb up a few pockets, pick the safest holds on the top of the lip and pull over the lip.
content.protection: A few pads and a good spotter.
content.location: This is the first route that traverses into the padded room area and up the arete to the face.

content.description: Sit start with nice pockets, climb up the arete and make each move a conscious one.
content.protection: not much protection for this problem.
content.location: This is the problem on the arete to the left of the room.

content.description: Anyone know the FA? Fun and obvious one move line in the center of the wall. A committing leap brings you to the sloper at the lip. Should clean up nicely with more traffic. Can be protected well by stuffing a pad into the pit in the landing area and placing others on top.
content.protection: A few pads and spotters. Not an issue if you came prepared for Petri Dish. CLIMB PETRI DISH.
content.location: Starts matched on the center jug at chest height between Pressed for Jess and Petri Dish.
